title: Soda–lime glass
summary: Soda–lime glass, also called soda–lime–silica glass, is the most prevalent type of glass, used for windowpanes and glass containers (bottles and jars) for beverages, food, and some commodity items. Some glass bakeware is made of soda-lime glass, as opposed to the more common borosilicate glass.[1] Soda–lime glass accounts for about 90% of manufactured glass.[2][3]
